intro: Ceratocarpus, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its unique, spiny bracts that surround the flower heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plants typically grow in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They produce small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer or early autumn. Ceratocarpus species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their hardy nature and visual appeal.
